line.originaltext: 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/2 cups toasted wheat germ
1 cup quick-cooking oats
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
1/2 cup canola oil
2 egg, lightly beaten
1 cup miniature chocolate chips
1/2 cup chopped walnuts or pecans
In a large mixing bowl, combine the first six ingredients.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the first six ingredients.
line.annotation: combine({ing0, ing1, ing2, ing3, ing4, ing5}, ing11, "dry mix", "combine")

line.originaltext: In a large mixing bowl, combine the first six ingredients.
Combine the applesauce, oil and eggs.
Add to the flour mixture; mix well.
Stir in the chocolate chip and walnuts.
Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 in.
apart onto baking sheets coated with nonstick cooking spray.
apart onto baking sheets coated with nonstick cooking spray.
line.annotation: do(ing14, t1, ing15, "cookie batter", "rounded teaspoons 2 in. apart")

line.originaltext: Flatten slightly with a glass bottom coated with nonstick cooking spray.
line.annotation: create_tool(t2, "glass bottom coated with nonstick cooking spray")

line.originaltext: Flatten slightly with a glass bottom coated with nonstick cooking spray.
line.annotation: do(ing15, t2, ing16, "flattened cookie dough", "flatten slightly")

line.originaltext: Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 10-12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned and cookies are set.
line.annotation: chefcheck(ing17,"edges are lightly browned and cookies are set")

line.originaltext: Cool for 1 minute before removing to wire racks.
